text:
NAEB DESCRIPTIVE STATEMENT
(General)
Revised
December 1, 1954
Name: The National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Date Founded: 1925
Address: 14 Gregory Hall, Urbana, Illinois
Officers:
President: Mr. Frank E. Schooley Secretary:
Stations WILL-AM-F^-JV
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Vice
President: Mr. John Dunn Treasurer:
Oklahoma ETV Authority
P. 0. Box 2005
Norman, Oklahoma
Immediate Past President & Member of the Board of Directors:
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
Radio Station WUOA
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Earlier Name: Formerly the Association of College University Broadcasting
Stations (Name changed 1934).
Membership Categories:
a. Noncommercial educational institutions owning and operating their own
radio or television stations (actives);
b. Educational production centers (associates);
c. Individuals or organizations (not qualifying under above categories)
interested in furthering the cause of educational broadcasting (affiliates).
Number of Members as of December 1, 1954s
Active (Radio) 108
Active (TV) 10
Associate (Radio) 99
Associate (TV) 3
Affiliates 30
Honorary 3
Principal Sources of Revenue: Membership dues, Network Assessment Fees, sale of
materials and publications, Foundation support (W. K. Kellogg, Fund for
Adult Education, Rockefeller)
Mr. William Harley
Stations WHA-AM-FM-TV
University of Wisconsin
Madison 6, Wisconsin
Mr. Robert J. Coleman
Radio Stations WKAR-AM-FM
Michigan State College
East Lansing, Michigan
